page.title: 09Life Today in Coolham
page.content: Along the A272 is Willow Cottage, the home of Layla, George & Jessie who all attend William Penn School. Willow Cottage has an acre of land and at the bottom of the paddock is a tributary stream to the River Adur. Next door is St. Julian's farm, where most of the locals buy their milk." We fetch our milk in the morning or the evening. Opposite the old mission where my friends now live is the Playing Field. It belongs to the Parish Council and is a lovely, safe place to play. Nearby is the old butcher's shop where my friend Tamsin lives. Willow Cottage is very peaceful as all the fir trees hide it from the main road. A main feature of the house is its tile hanging. Living in Coolham is quite a privilege in itself for William Penn is a delightful school to work and play at."
